jobs.featured_text: Be part of the team that builds some of the best websites for the gaming industry
jobs.title: Front End Developer

jobs.description:
Check out this video to learn about being a Software Engineer at Prudential!
(https://video.digi-me.com/digime/jobs/Accounting/Prudential/Software Developer/ZP0020)

Prudential is looking for a Front End Software Engineer, who have passion for new technologies, understand responsive web development, can prototype rapidly, and turn concepts to life. As a developer, you care about quality of code, understand how to work with several content types, love to learn new technologies, and are ready to adapt on changing design frameworks and design principles. Experience in mobile not needed but preferred. Needless to say, you will have knowledge on how back-end systems work. Details are critical as you iterate on complex interactions and have pride in your work output. You understand browsers and enjoy simplifying that complexity. We are looking for someone who loves a good challenge and can work collaboratively

We are building a startup culture in a company that is touching 20 Million+ lives, yet thinks agile. A company where talent drives success and your work touches everyone from a 25 year old to folks over 90 years old living in retirement. We care about web accessibility. We care how we treat our customers. Our employees are passionate about what they do and make it happen. 


If you are interested in applying, please use the link below:
(http://jobs.prudential.com/job-description.php?jobReqNo=CO%2000019)


**Responsibilities:** 

•Collaborate with product management, marketing, designers, and technology and architecture teams


•Work in a rapid pace environment with ability to juggle multiple projects 


•Enjoy learning about our customers and our businesses 


•Proven ability to work in an iterative/Agile environment



**Qualifications:**

•BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. 
•5+ years of front end development experience
•Experience with incorporating accessibility into prototypes preferred
•Proficiency in XHTML / HTML5, CSS2, CSS3, Sass, Scss and Bootstrap frameworks
•Experience with Object Oriented JavaScript and modern JavaScript libraries (e.g., Closure, jQuery, NodeJS, AngularJS)
•Proficiency in Code editor of choice (Dreamweaver, Sublime, Brackets)
•Working knowledge of Bower and Grunt
•Working knowledge of CMS integration ( WCM) preferred
•Working knowledge of design software (Photoshop, Illustrator, Fireworks) preferred
•Experience in financial services or B2B2C organizations a huge plus
•A conceptual thinker who can articulate and execute his/her vision from concept to production
•A TECHIE that lives for emerging technologies, and is hungry to keep learning
•An entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to collaborate in a corporate environment 
•Enjoys working hard and appreciates a good laugh
jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer

jobs.description:
Prudential’s US Customer Office is seeking a talented, senior-level User Interface Designer to develop the next generation of our digital experience. As part of the Design System team you will collaborate directly with product owners, marketing managers, and visual designers to design and code intuitive web interfaces that balance user need with business goals.

If you are interested in applying, please use the link below: (http://jobs.prudential.com/job-description.php?jobReqNo=UX%200001H)


**Responsibilities:**

·        Knowledge web markup, HTML, CSS, and some fundamental understanding of JavaScript

·        Great sense of typography, iconography, color theory, and visual composition

·        Mastery of Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, and other modern design and prototyping tools

·        Create code functional prototypes that are WC3 and ADA accessibility complaint

·        Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks

·        Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand off to development.

·        Work closely with development teams to ensure ideas can be brought to life

·        Maintain a cohesive design system while defining new user interface patterns.

·        Ensure a consistent customer experience while reviewing projects and identifying new reusable components

·        Systematically develop new and/or enhance existing front-end components.

·        Develop high level and detailed storyboards, mockups to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas

·        Collaborate with our existing UX Designer and assist with workload as needed.

·        Passionate about staying current of web technologies, best practices and industry standards

·        Partner with product owners, marketing teams and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction

·        Translate user requirements into usable interfaces aligning with business goals.

·        Research and analyze interfaces of competitive products


**Qualifications** 
·        Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Digital Arts, Information Technology, Computer Software/Engineering or a related field. Alternatively, will accept an Associates (2) year degree or foreign equivalent in a related field plus two (2) years working experience related position.
jobs.title: UI Designer

jobs.description:
###Senior UX Designer

Prudential’s US Customer Office is seeking a talented, User Experience Designer to help design the next level of interactive experiences. You will collaborate directly with a team of passionate product owners, marketing managers, visual & interactive designers, and researchers to create intuitive web interfaces and interactive tools that balance user need with business goals.

Feel free to explore the site below to see what the UX team in Customer Office is up to!
(https://medium.com/prudential-design)

If you are interested in applying, please use the link below:
(http://jobs.prudential.com/job-description.php?jobReqNo=UX%200001D)



**Responsibilities:**

·        Research and understand complexities of our user needs as they relate to digital experience.

·        Demonstrate strong ability to sell your vision to peers and senior management!

·        Help define and be a voice for user needs related to all project design. Help find or develop data capture, competitive analysis, and developed personas. 

·        Partner with product owners & marketing teams to define requirements, user stories, and provide functional, innovative solutions.

·        Work directly with visual and interactive design teams to ensure design and development is applied properly to intended experience that you defined. Able to document experience fully for our product and development team execution.

·        Create mockups, user journeys, wireframes as needed to communicate experience design and intent for new ideas.

·        Test your ideas/designs for usability issues ahead of development and follow though beyond delivery.

·        Promote and foster inclusive design/development practices through better understanding of web accessibility as applied to your experience solutions.

·        Able to take loose requirements and concept on the fly with a strong agile mindset.

·        Able to think ahead in designing for larger UI framework systems and specifically for responsive design.


**Qualifications:**

·        Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Digital Arts, Information Technology, Computer Software/Engineering or a related field plus 5+ years experience

·        Front end development experience or strong understanding is a huge plus

·        Ability to work independently as necessary to move projects forward

·        Ability to focus in an ever-shifting internal and external landscape

·        Mastery of Sketch, InVision, and information architecture organizational skills to clearly define your vision.

·        A portfolio demonstrating your thought process for solving a real user need.
jobs.title: Senior UX Designer

jobs.title: Senior Front End Engineer

jobs.description:
We need design-minded front end developers with deep knowledge of modern web development to create next generation user interfaces. We are leveraging a Chromium integration paired with powerful VR APIs to present web apps in holographic 3D to devices like the Oculus Rift and HTC Vive. Forget supporting IE. With us you'd be programming against HUDs, non-rectangular displays, and holographic projectors.  

[See more about AltspaceVR](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CQtQGoMRXaI) 

We are:  

- A virtual reality software company [https://twitter.com/AltspaceVR](https://twitter.com/AltspaceVR)  
- Backed by some of the best investors on the planet [http://altvr.com/about/](http://altvr.com/about/)  
- A team that is passionate about the future of VR  [http://altvr.com/team/](http://altvr.com/team/)  

**[Apply!](https://jobs.lever.co/altspace/9761fb55-6bf5-4d49-852d-6ad9b09154eb)**
jobs.title: Virtual Reality Front End UI Engineer
